detailsOfAchievement: AMYAA The Alombro Mayu Yaku Chi Amey Aroga (AMYAA), Society for social transformation was registered under the Societies Registration Act 1860 on June 28 2002 with its head office at Mayu-II, Roing of Lower Dibang Valley District. On 17th November 2009 the Head Office was shifted from Roing to Namphai-I, Miao of Changlang District. This shifting of Head Office was done on ground of feasibility in reaching out to the needy and the poor in remote rural villages. This society was established with the vision to combat poverty, illiteracy, ill health, corruption, injustice and suppression of the poor. The society focuses at working for the all round development of the tribal communities. It aims at supporting the backward tribal communities to become self-sustainable and self-reliant. Vision AMYAA envisages a society where everyone co-exists in mutual respect and understanding and strive for justice, peace and love. Mission AMYAA is to work for the all round development of the tribal poor with special attention towards the most vulnerable groups of the society, children, youth and women. It follows Right-based Approach in promoting developmental changes through creating awareness, capacity building, and training and to establish a self-sustainable and self-reliant society in Arunachal Pradesh. Location AMYAA is located in the scenic beauty of Namphai-I, with swift flowing breath taking scene of Dehing River as its background. There is greenery and a sight to cherish nature surrounding the Office. Office Set Up The office is well furnished with computer and other electronic equipments for documentation and processing of project related activities. MAJOR ACTIVITIES 1) Training cum Production Centre (Handloom and Handicrafts) Aim: To promote traditional attires To promote traditional art To train local artisans To train and help the village youth (illiterate & educated unemployed youth) to develop their skills and to become self-employable and employable To provide employment in the centre To improve the economic standards of their families To raise the economy of the society To reduce the number of youth getting addicted to anti-social activities Activities Undertaken: Handloom Traditional Handloom - Mekhela set, traditional shawl, traditional coat, traditional turban. Activities Undertaken: Handicrafts Making of various items such as kitchen utensils, dry flowers, statues of state animal & bird, traditional statues, decorative articles etc 2) Youth (educated unemployed youth) Skill Development Programme (SDP) & Rural Entrepreneurship Development Programme (REDP) for educated unemployed youth Career guidance & counseling Capacity Building & Training on various trade skills Exposure 3) Livelihood SHG formation Farmer Club formation Promotion of Traditional Handloom & Handicrafts Income Generation Activities REDP & SDP for Women groups Capacity Building for staff on live stock management Exposure 4) Health Village level awareness program Animation for village women & youth on health related topics Medical camp once in six months Work in collaboration with Govt. heath centres Capacity Building for staff on health related issues 5) Education Village level awareness programme on the importance of education Counseling cum Career guidance programme for higher class students Seminar/workshop for students and teachers Training on Computer Skills ACHIEVEMENTS Reaching out to more than 1500 educated unemployed youth of the State within a span of 4 months through SDP programmes. Formation of Self Help Groups to empower rural women in economic development ventures. Formation of Farmers Club to help and support 300 farmers in agri-related activities with the application of modern science and technologies. Awareness programme in legal aid and importance of education in rural areas. Awareness programme in health related issues and helping the poor through free medical camps. Generating employment for unemployed educated youth by setting up of handloom and handicrafts units.

detailsOfAchievement: As of now the organisation is involved in a variety of activities such as- (a) A Residential School for Tribal Children from remote pockets who are the unreached and the unprivileged. It is an ongoing project sponsored by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt. of India. The school at present catering to the need of quality education to 280 children ranging from 1st to 10th Standard and is duly recognized by the Directorate of School Education, Govt. of A.P. and affiliated to CBSE, (b) A Mobile Dispensary Unit sponsored by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt of India, New Delhi, in order to bridge the gap of medical services to the people in the remote pockets in the state of Arunachal Pradesh, (c) A De-Addiction Centre sponsored by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of India for Prevention of Drug Abuse for a healthy drugs abuse free society in the state, (d) 3 Targeted Intervention Project for Prevention of HIV/AIDS which projects are being in the entire Lohit District covering the core and bridge population, (e) A Museum cum Research Centre for preservation of arts and artifacts and research on Tai Khamti & Singpho People and Culture in the state of Arunachal Pradesh and (f) Running of a Guest House for visitors to the place

detailsOfAchievement: Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti Main Achievements The notable educational achievements of Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti are as follows: 1. Providing qualitative nationalistic education through 16 nos of coeducational schools in 10 districts of Arunachal Pradesh. These schools are located in remote interior villages of Arunachal Pradesh with low access to quality education In these schools, activities for the integrated development of the five aspects (five koshas) of human personality through the five core areas of Sharirik (Physical), Yog, Sanskrit, Sangeet (Music) and Naitik Adhyatmik (Moral & Spiritual ) Education are effectively carried out. 2. Running 9 (nine) numbers of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas (KGBVs) in 2 (two) districts of Siang and East Siang districts of Arunachal Pradesh. These schools are exclusively residential and free Schools for girls under SSA aimed universalisation of elementary education. These 9 KGBVs run by Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samti have evolved to be the best and model schools among the government projects in Arunachal Pradesh because of its quality education program in the lines of Vidya Bharati as well as the vocational and specific skill development programs conducted in these schools. 3. Providing academic and allied support to 5 (five) nos of Associated Schools in 3 districts of Upper Subansiri, Changlang and Namsai. Though directly not managed by the Samiti, these schools also follow the quality educational programs (scholastic and co-scholastic) of Vidya Bharati and bring out qualitative outcomes. The local management bodies of these schools are getting expertise regarding school administration from the Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti. 4. Regularly organizing teachers quality enhancement programs like Teachers Training, workshops, etc. Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti conducts Teachers Training camps of 10 day duration with at least 50  60 teachers every year. Through these training camps, the Samiti imparts training to teachers in the areas of qualitative teaching learning methods, effective ways of evaluation, preparation of low cost/ no cost teaching aids, etc. More than 500 teachers have been effectively trained through these camps so far. 5. Annually organizing inter school sports, Science fests, literary and cultural competitions, Band Training, Personality Development camps, etc for students. In these separate events sports competitions like races, jumps (long jump & high jump), shot put and discus throw, games like kabaddi, volley ball, tug of war, archery etc are conducted and the hidden talents in those areas are traced and promoted. In the Science Fests under the Akhil Bharatiya Vigyan Mela scheme of Vidya Bharati, competitions among students are conducted at school level, cluster level and state level in the areas of science experimentation, exhibition, paper presentation, science quiz etc and the winners are awarded with prizes and promoted for higher level competitions. Similar efforts are being made through the Kala and Sanskritik Melas, etc in the respective fields. 6. Promotion of Girls Education has been one of the key areas of attention for the Vidya Bharati and Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti as well. The Samiti has been following the Balika Shiksha karyakram of the Vidya Bharati in true spirit and organizing special programs like Balika Shivir (Girls Convention) Exhibition of Vocational and craft items prepared by girl students under the intervention of Balika Shiksha (Girls Education). Balika Sabhas and Matri Bharatis (MothersCouncils) etc in the all schools. 7. Shiksha Setu: Identification of promising students with bright scholastic career for free education in Vidya Bharati schools outside the state. Nearly 50 students benefitted so far

detailsOfAchievement: Over the years the Society has been working untiringly to achieve the following objectives with the well- knit organizational structure. a) To preserve and promote Buddhist cultural heritage of India and the local folk culture including rituals, performing arts and local traditional handicrafts. b) To preserve and protect holy places, sacred enclosures and historical monuments in the West Kameng and Tawang districts of Arunachal Pradesh. c) To establish and run hospitals, schools and other educational institutions for the benefit of the poor and unprivileged section of the rural population. d) To undertake research and publication works. We have established the following institutions for the socio-cultural and spiritual upliftment of the tribals in this frontier region: i) Gontse Gaden Rabgye Ling Monastery, Bomdila ii) Central Institute of Himalayan Culture Studies, Dahung(Now taken over by the Govt. of India) iii) Shanti Deva Vidyalaya, Mon Bomdila iv) Monyul Development Centre, Lhou v) Gorsam Stupa Culture Centre, Zemithang vi) Jangchub Choeling Nunnery, Lhou vii) Dolma Lhakhang, Lumla viii) Computer Training Center, Mon Bomdila ix) Sowa-Rigpa and Allopathic Clinic, Bomdila

title: Centre for Buddhist Cultural Studies
detailsOfAchievement: Introduction: Centre for Buddhist Cultural Studies was established and developed into a residential school on proper lines based on modern education system into the framework of traditional education system of the monastery. It was established in 1977 to impart monastic as well as modern education to the monk students. The following major activities of Centre for Buddhist Cultural Studies as follow: 1. Established a residential school for the education of monk students, where basic education is imparted free of cost. 2. Conducted various workshops and seminars on the preservation and promotion the rich cultural heritage of the region which face various challenges for survival in todays fast changing world. 3. Imparted traditional monastic education to younger resident monks with a balance incorporation of modern languages and scientific knowledge with objective of producing erudite scholars and philosophers who are capable of preserving and carrying on the ancient cultural heritages of the region in the context of modern day situation. 4. Prepared students for higher learning and research in the field of the Buddhist Culture, Tibetology and Himalayan Studies, art and culture with adequate background in various disciplines of learning, with thorough knowledge of modern research and advanced technique. 5. Inculcated awareness in the preservation of environment and cultural resources of the region. 6. Inculcated deep feeling of patriotism, national integrity, brotherhood, and developing a greater sense of harmony in the country. 7. Produced ideal citizens who work for the development of the nation and its citizens. 8. Made full utilization of modern scientific and technological resources in preserving and promoting the age old wisdom of India for the benefit of entire sentient beings as a whole and Schedule Tribes community in particular. 9. Provided free medical treatments to the monk patients along with needy patients belonging to poor family background. 10. Planted saplings around Tawang Monastery and other adjoining areas which are vulnerable to landslides and other natural calamities. 11. Conducted cleanliness drive at important public buildings such as schools, hospitals and market areas as a part of Swach Bharat Abhiyan. 12. Established a library inside the premises of Tawang Monastery which is open to general public from 10 am to 4 pm, irrespective of caste, creed, community etc. The library houses books on varied subjects ranging from education, science to politics.

detailsOfAchievement: 1. To promote the peace and harmony among the various section of people irrespective of caste and creed. 2. To provide free education and skill development training to poor tribal women for their empowerment and economic development of their family. 3. To maintain the unity, integrity among the indigenous tribe of Arunachal Pradesh in particular and India as whole throughout the Chayang Mission. 4. To learn the Ethics and moral doctrines of truthfulness straightness, love to parents, respect to and compassion self respect equality, fraternity self dependents and self sufficient and mercy. 5. To establish Educational Institution for better brain culture and work culture. 6. To encourage and promote tradition rich handicraft and handloom, SSI unit and business venture. 7. To promote Tourism and focus the people of other state in natural beauty and all about its flora and fauna. 8. To establish piggery farm, Dairy farm, Goatery Farm, Fishery for self income generation purpose and other vocational orientation Institution. 9. To protect and preserve the hidden indigenous rich culture of Tribal societies. 10. To assist the Govt. in the time of any national emergency such as natural calamities and epidemics etc. 11. To protect against destruction of environment eco friendly such as fish in natural water wild life and destruction of forest. 12. To encourage the social forestry in the State. 13. To discourage the social evil practices such as polygamy, child marriage, force marriage and bonded labour. 14. To promote the living condition of rural masses by imparting awareness campaign about the Govt. plans and programmes. 15. To dissuade the Jhum cultivation. 16. To motivate, to organize the local people for promoting the Tea Cultivation, Horticulture, Agriculture & Sericulture etc. 17. To establish Medicinal plantation for economic gain of the society. 18. This society may establish shelter for old age men & women. 19. To establish forest base industry like cane, bamboo and wood etc. 20. To establish adult education centers. 21. To encourage and establish village forest area. 22. To acquire by gifts, purchase, exchange lease on higher or otherwise however and land building, easement and any property movables or immovable of any estate for the furtherance of all or the objectives of the institution. 23. To acquire funds from abroad for the fulfillment of any or all the above mentioned aim and objectives of the Mission with prior permission from the Government of India from time to time. 24. To do all other lawful things incidental or duly constitute managing committee as provided in the rules and regulations of the institution from time to time.

detailsOfAchievement: To work for the overall Development of the society. To undertake project for self- employment such as horticulture and agriculture development. To shoulder responsibilities of relief and rehabilitation works and render voluntary services to the people especially during the of natural calamities/ epidemics and other emergencies. To maintain the highest possible standard of humanitarian service by running welfare institute like orphanage/ Orphan school/ old age homes/Vocational Institute/ Training centers/ health center/ welfare of woman/ widow/ Welfare of children/ woman adult Education/ Discourage of Child and Force marriage. To assist and undertake preventive and control measures in disaster prone zones and crisis management in disaster stricken localities. To promote eco-tourism. To encourage rainwater rainwater harvesting and promote use of non- conventional means of energy in remote areas especially solar. To established functional linkages with other reputed NGOs functioning at state, Region,Nation, And International Level. There shall not be any profit motive while carrying out the activities and achieving the objects of the society. the surplus fund/ assist, if shall be utilized only in furtherance of the object of the society. Promote entrepreneurship in both rural and urban areas. Working handloom and handicraft activities and rural areas. To cooperate, collaborate with center/state and other agencies to undertake development programmes in Rural and Urban Areas. To conduct and also to assist in organising training and study courses, conferences, seminar, workshops etc. on rural development and allied subjects. To work towards better health in rural and urban areas, create awareness on AIDS/HIV and to address other similar issue in the broader interest of people. Accept grants of money securities of property of any kind undertaken and accept the management of any endowment, trust, fund or donation not inconsistent with the object of the society on such terms from time to time. To receive grants and aids from othe World Bank and also contribution/donation from NRIs and other well-wisher to achieve the objrct of the society. Invest and deal with funds moneys of the society. Impose and recover fee and charge for the services rendered by it. Purchase hire take on lease exchange or otherwise acquire a property movable or immovable which may be necessary or convenient for the purpose the society and construct after and or maintain such building and works as may be necessary for carrying out the object of the society. sell, hire, lease exchange or otherwise transfer or dispose of all or any property, movable or immovable of the society provide that for the transfer of immobile property prior approval in writing of the Government of Arunachal Pradesh is obtained in that behalf. Draw, accept, make, endorse, discount and deposit Government of India and other promissory item, bills of exchange, cheque or other negotaible instrument. Create reserve Fund, sinking Fund, Insurance Fund or any other especial fund whether for depreciation, repairs, improvements, extension or maintenance of any of the properties or rights of the society and/or for recouping, wasting and for any other purpose for which the society deems it expedient or proper to create or maintain any such fund or funds. The area of operation of the society will be throughout Arunachal Pradesh and need based within the National Boundaries.
